Q3a.text: Q3a: Calculate the average induced EMF in the circular loop (radius 10 cm, resistance 10 Ω) during the rising portion of the magnetic field.

Q3b.text: Q3b: Estimate the average current flowing through the loop.

Q4a.text: Q4a: A solenoid with 500 turns/m carries a current ramping from 0 A to 4.0 A in 0.20 s. The solenoid has a cross-sectional area of 20 cm². What is the voltmeter reading (in \U+03BC V) on a circular ring placed inside the solenoid during the current ramp-up?

Q5a.text: Q5a: A rectangular loop is being pulled to the right at 3 m/s while partially in a 0.25 T magnetic field (with the vertical dimension of the loop being 6 cm). Calculate the induced EMF in the loop.

Q6a.text: Q6a: A conducting bar slides along rails in a uniform 1.2 T magnetic field. The rails are 40 cm apart and the bar moves at 2.0 m/s. Calculate the induced EMF across the bar.

Q6b.text: Q6b: Determine the magnitude of the induced current in the circuit (the resistor is 10 Ω).

Q6c.text: Q6c: Compute the power dissipated in the resistor.

Q6e.text: Q6e: Find the magnetic force acting on the sliding bar.

Q6f.text: Q6f: What is the external force required to maintain the bar’s constant velocity?

Q6g.text: Q6g: Calculate the mechanical power delivered by the pulling force.

Q6h.text: Q6h: When the setup is vertical and the bar falls at 10 m/s, estimate the minimum mass the bar must have.

Q6i.text: Q6i: Find the induced current when the bar falls vertically at 10 m/s.

Q6j.text: Q6j: Calculate the total thermal energy generated in the resistor while the bar falls 2 m at constant speed.

Q6k.text: Q6k: Determine the change in gravitational potential energy as the bar falls 2 m.

Q7a.text: Q7a: In an electric toothbrush, the secondary coil (N = 200 turns, radius 1.2 cm) experiences a linearly rising magnetic field (from 0 to 0.01 T over 2.5 ms). Estimate the magnitude of the induced EMF during the rising phase.

Q7b.text: Q7b: Based on the induced EMF and a circuit resistance of 5.0 Ω, calculate (i) the average current in the secondary circuit and (ii) the charging time (in hours) for a 500 mAh battery.
